meanings.definition: A person or organization that promotes or supports a cause or idea.
meanings.sent1: The promotor of the charity event worked tirelessly to raise awareness.
meanings.sent2: The promotor of the new product launch ensured it reached a wide audience.
meanings.sent3: The promotor of the 'Eat Dessert First' campaign certainly has a sweet tooth!
meanings.sent4: Her infectious enthusiasm acted as a promotor for positivity in the community.
meanings.sent5: The promotor's passion for environmental conservation was truly inspiring.

meanings.definition: An individual who organizes and oversees an event or activity.
meanings.sent1: As the promotor of the music festival, he coordinated all the performances.
meanings.sent2: The promotor of the school play ensured everything ran smoothly backstage.
meanings.sent3: The promotor of the bake sale had a tough time resisting the tempting treats.
meanings.sent4: She was the promotor of fun at the carnival, making sure everyone had a great time.
meanings.sent5: The promotor's attention to detail made the event a huge success.

meanings.definition: A substance that initiates or accelerates a chemical reaction.
meanings.sent1: The promotor in the experiment caused the reaction to occur faster.
meanings.sent2: Adding the promotor to the mixture significantly sped up the process.
meanings.sent3: The promotor in the lab was like a little spark that ignited the whole reaction.
meanings.sent4: The promotor acted as a catalyst, bringing about the desired chemical change.
meanings.sent5: The promotor's role was crucial in kickstarting the chemical transformation.
